019package org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc;
020
021import static java.lang.System.err;
022import static java.lang.System.out;
023import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common.createLineNumberFormatString;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
027
028import java.io.BufferedReader;
029import java.io.File;
030import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
031import java.io.FileReader;
032import java.io.FileWriter;
033import java.io.IOException;
034import java.util.ArrayList;
035import java.util.List;
036
037import org.apiguardian.api.API;
038import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
039import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ProgramClass;
040import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError;
041import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils;
042
043/**
044 *  A tool that can be used to create an HTML file suitable as a documentation
045 *  extension for a JavaDoc from an arbitrary text file. The processing of the
046 *  input is as for
047 *  {@link IncludeTaglet.ProcessMode#SOURCE}. <br>
048 *  <br>The program takes two command line arguments:
049 *  <ol>
050 *  <li>The file name for the input file.</li>
051 *  <li>The destination path for the output file.</li>
052 *  </ol>
053 *  <br>The name of the output file will be determined by the name of the input
054 *  file, suffixed with &quot;{@code .html}&quot;. This means, the input file
055 *  &quot;{@code MyClass.java}&quot; is written to
056 *  &quot;{@code MyClass.java.html}&quot;.<br>
057 *  <br>An already existing file will be overwritten without warning.
058 *
059 *  @note The output file should be stored into a {@code doc-files} folder in
060 *      the source tree of the project from where JavaDoc will pick it up and
061 *      amends it appropriately. This is similar to the handling of the HTML
062 *      file containing the project overview that is addressed with the
063 *      {@code -overview} option on the JavaDoc command line.
064 *
065 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
066 *  @version $Id: CreateSourceHTML.java 825 2021-01-03 17:50:44Z tquadrat $
067 *  @since 0.0.5
068 *
069 *  @UMLGraph.link
070 */
071@ProgramClass
072@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: CreateSourceHTML.java 825 2021-01-03 17:50:44Z tquadrat $" )
073@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5")
074public final class CreateSourceHTML
075{
076        /*--------------*\
077    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
078        \*--------------*/
079    /**
080     *  No instance allowed for this class.
081     */
082    private CreateSourceHTML() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( CreateSourceHTML.class ); }
083
084        /*---------*\
085    ====** Methods **==========================================================
086        \*---------*/
087    /**
088     *  Generates a documentation extension HTML file from the given source
089     *  file.
090     *
091     *  @param  inputFile   The input file.
092     *  @param  outputPath  The output path.
093     *  @throws IOException Reading or writing failed.
094     */
095    @SuppressWarnings( "resource" )
096    public static final void execute( final File inputFile, final File outputPath ) throws IOException
097    {
098        if ( !requireNonNullArgument( inputFile, "inputFile" ).exists() )
099        {
100            throw new FileNotFoundException( inputFile.getAbsolutePath() );
101        }
102        out.printf( "Input File : %s\n", inputFile.getAbsolutePath() );
103
104        if( requireNonNullArgument( outputPath, "outputPath" ).exists() && !outputPath.isDirectory() )
105        {
106            throw new IOException( format( "%s is not a directory", outputPath.getAbsolutePath() ) );
107        }
108        if( !outputPath.exists() )
109        {
110            if( !outputPath.mkdirs() )
111            {
112                throw new IOException( format( "Cannot create output directory: %s", outputPath.getAbsolutePath() ) );
113            }
114        }
115
116        final var fileName = inputFile.getName() + ".html";
117        final var outputFile = new File( outputPath, fileName );
118        out.printf( "Output File: %s\n", outputFile.getAbsolutePath() );
119
120        final List<String> lines = new ArrayList<>();
121        try( final var reader = new BufferedReader( new FileReader( inputFile ) ) )
122        {
123            reader.lines()
124                .map( StringUtils::escapeHTML )
125                .forEach( lines::add );
126        }
127
128        final var lineNumberFormat = createLineNumberFormatString( lines.size() );
129        var lineNumber = 1;
130
131        final var buffer = new StringBuilder(
132            """
133            <!DOCTYPE html>
134            <html>
135            <head>
136            <meta charset="UTF-8">
137            <title>Source Code</title>
138            </head>
139            <body>
140            <h1>Source Code</h1>
141            <p><div class="source-container"><pre>""" );
142        for( final var line : lines )
143        {
144            buffer.append( format( lineNumberFormat, lineNumber++ ) )
145                .append( line )
146                .append( '\n' );
147        }
148        buffer.append(
149            """
150            </pre></div></p>
151            </body>
152            </html>""" );
153
154        try( final var writer = new FileWriter( outputFile ) )
155        {
156            writer.append( buffer ).flush();
157        }
158
159        out.println( "Done!" );
160    }   //  execute()
161
162    /**
163     *  The program entry point.
164     *
165     *  @param  args    The command line arguments.
166     */
167    @SuppressWarnings( {"ThrowCaughtLocally", "OverlyBroadCatchBlock"} )
168    public static void main( final String... args )
169    {
170        try
171        {
172            if( args.length != 2 )
173            {
174                throw new IllegalArgumentException( format( "Usage: %s <InputFile> <OutputPath>", CreateSourceHTML.class.getSimpleName() ) );
175            }
176            final var inputFile = new File( args [0] ).getCanonicalFile().getAbsoluteFile();
177            final var outputPath = new File( args [1] ).getCanonicalFile().getAbsoluteFile();
178
179            execute( inputFile, outputPath );
180        }
181        catch( final Throwable t )
182        {
183            //---* Handle any previously unhandled exceptions *----------------
184            t.printStackTrace( err );
185        }
186    }   //  main()
187}
188//  class CreateSourceHTML
189
